passages.name: shark swim by
passages.text:
Your spotlight shines steadily forward as the shadow skates around your field of vision, then vanishes into the darkness.
….what do you think that was, Doc? New species?
…I don't know, Jackie. Keep an eye out on the surface though, Whitetips like to follow boats, so maybe this one…"
Sure. Try convincing yourself of that first, Doc.
Log: Oceanic White-Tip Shark? Carcharhinus longimanus? Estimated size: minimum 5m
[[Ascend|twitosuntrans][$destination = "sunlight 2"]] [[Left|twilight 1]][[Right|twilight 3]] <>[[Descend|twitomidtrans][$destination = "mid 2"]]<>[[Descend|twitomid][$destination = "mid 2"]]<>

passages.name: mute
passages.text:
With a push of a button, you are alone. Miles away from the surface, from light, from air.

At least, that's what you thought as you entered the temple. You thought it'd be dark and deep as the rest of the sea has been, but once again, the world surprises you.

Because when you look up, you see stars. Twinkling, glittering lights set into the roof of the temple. They are almost enough to see by, as if you were no longer underwater, but instead engulfed in a welcoming night.

Through the haze of water and darkness, you can see an altar in the front of the room, decorated with glowing blue flowers (anemones? They're like none you've seen before).

And beyond that, a black even your spotlight doesn't penetrate.

[[Return to the Surface.|leave]]
[[Enter the Darkness.|dark]]

passages.name: entryway
passages.text:
The sea floor suddenly gives way to a harsh cliffside, ragged and cutting. You steer the ship away from the sharp edges, keeping an eye on the darkness below.
This was supposed to be the bottom. Is there something wrong with our equipment?
"There has to be. I mean, that's a trench."
But it can't be!
[[I wonder how deep it goes.|deep]][[No use denying the facts.|facts]]

links.text: I wonder how deep it goes.

passages.name: Twi to Mid
rlyeh
passages.text:
"I think we found R'lyeh."
That's just a story by some racist crackpot. It's probably just some naturally occuri-
Her words die out as your spotlight catches on an honest-to-god building. Its domed roof fades into the darkness, held up by barely eroded columns. A delicate molding decorates the edges of a wide entryway, flowing like tides or tentacles. If you aim your light just so, you can see more shapes, tall and ominous rising behind the temple. The entryway is more than wide enough to fit your sub through. [[Return to the Surface.|leave]] [[Approach the Temple.|temple]][[Look behind the Temple.|behind]]

passages.name: AbysstoSun
facts
passages.text:
"No use denying the facts."
Still, this isn't part of the plan, Doc.
"Come on, Jackie. For science?
…well, if it's for science. Still, you could always come back up.
[[Back to the surface|top end]] [[Descend|trench 2]]

passages.name: fine
passages.text:
"I'm here. Everything's fine."
Your voice shakes. It sounds odd inside the tiny cockpit, as if you'd never heard it before.
Good. You just went all quiet for a while. Did you see something?
"No. I didn't see anything…"
You don't know if you wish you had.
Log: ??? ??? Estimated size: Big
[[Ascend|midtotwitrans][$destination = "twilight 1"]] [[Left|mid 5]][[Right|mid 2]] <>[[Descend|midtoabysstrans][$destination = "abyss 1"]]<>[[Descend|midtoabyss][$destination = "abyss 1"]]<>

passages.name: trench 3 louder
passages.text:
<>The song only gets louder now, coming from deep below you. You find yourself humming, as if you were familiar with the tune. The buzz of the radio shows that Jackie is humming as well. You look at your instruments and pause.
Depth: 11,500 m
That's not possible. The lowest point on earth is Challenger Deep, at 10,916 meters. You can't be deeper. [[Ask Jackie if its an error.|error]] [[Celebrate your discovery.|celebrate]]

links.text: Ask Jackie if its an error.

passages.name: coward end 2
passages.text:
You float your way back to the top, and break the surface. You see the sun again, as the crew rush over and help you out of the sub. Your legs are cramped in a way you hadn't even noticed. Jackie is frowning slightly.
Bit of a short dive, no?
You shrug.
"It was getting a little dangerous."
Yeah, I suppose... We'll just try again next time.
You nod, and can't shake the question. Could you have gone deeper? [[The End|credits]]

passages.name: StoryTitle
passages.text: Tangaroa Deep

passages.name: surface end 2
passages.text:
You float your way back to the top, and break the surface. You see the sun again, as the crew rush over and help you out of the sub. Your legs are cramped in a way you hadn't even noticed. Jackie is grinning from ear to ear.
That was a great dive, Doc.
You grin back, taking a long swig of water.
"It was. Did you get all the data you wanted?"
Oh yeah. We'll be drowning in it. Pun intended.
You smile at the joke but wonder. Could you have gone deeper? [[The End|credits]]

passages.text:

<> [[Image Attributions|dark attribute]] [[Back to Credits|dark credits]] Dive Again?

passages.name: mid 3
passages.text:
<>

The Midnight Zone (1000 m – 4000 m)

<> <>A flash, a movement, teeth. It's always startling when an animal you hadn't noticed swims past your viewports and this one is no exception. A frilled shark, sinuous and lithe, grins out at you, it's clusters of needle-like teeth gleaming under your lights.
I'm going to respectfully not bring up the sound you just made.
"That's you, Jackie. All respect."
Well if that's the response I'm gonna get, I'll stick with merciless teasing from now on. Gotta give you what you want.
Log: Frilled Shark Chlamydoselachus anguineus Estimated size: 1.5 m
<><><> The sea is wide and dark and gaping. You have already visited this patch of ocean.
Previously Logged: Frilled Shark Chlamydoselachus anguineus Estimated size: 1.5 m
<> [[Ascend|midtotwitrans][$destination = "twilight 3"]] [[Left|mid 2]][[Right|mid 4]] <>[[Descend|midtoabysstrans][$destination = "abyss 3"]]<>[[Descend|midtoabyss][$destination = "abyss 3"]]<>

passages.name: mid 2
passages.text:
<>

The Midnight Zone (1000 m – 4000 m)

<> <>
WATCH OUT!
Your instruments beep in warning a second before Jackie calls out and you try and grind the sub to a halt. It's too late to stop it though, before a white shape clips your hull and speeds off into the shadows, leaving a trail of blood hovering in the water.
Are you okay?! Doc!
"Y-yeah. Just some minor hull damage. We're still okay."
Be careful. The Tangaroa is sturdy but not crashing into whales sturdy. Man, that was nuts.
Log: Sperm Whale Physeter macrocephalus Estimated size: 14 m
<>
Damage to Hull
<><><> The sea is wide and dark and gaping. You have already visited this patch of ocean.
Previously Logged: Sperm Whale Physeter macrocephalus Estimated size: 14 m
<> [[Ascend|midtotwitrans][$destination = "twilight 2"]] [[Left|mid 1]][[Right|mid 3]] <>[[Descend|midtoabysstrans][$destination = "abyss 2"]]<>[[Descend|midtoabyss][$destination = "abyss 2"]]<>

passages.name: mid 1
passages.text:
<>

The Midnight Zone (1000 m – 4000 m)

<> <>You hear it first, a echoing, low-pitched wail. Only, it's different than what you're used to. Whale song always sounded like longing, like a call to a distant friend. This song is low and rumbling and lonely and angry and hungry and louder and louder and louder and
Doc? Doc!
Jackie's voice cuts through the song, and you sit, trembling for a moment in the sudden silence. [[Did you hear that?|hear]] [[Everything's fine.|fine]]<><> The sea is wide and dark and gaping. You have already visited this patch of ocean.
Previously Logged: ??? ??? Estimated size: Big
[[Ascend|midtotwitrans][$destination = "twilight 1"]] [[Left|mid 5]][[Right|mid 2]] <>[[Descend|midtoabysstrans][$destination = "abyss 1"]]<>[[Descend|midtoabyss][$destination = "abyss 1"]]<> <>

passages.name: lucky
passages.text:
"Looks like we're just lucky today."
Well let's hope that luck holds up. We've already got some great shots and I know we're going to be sorting through this data for weeks.
"…Sounds thrilling."
Well we can't all be bold adventurers like you, Doc. Someone needs to man the lab.
"Good thing we got the best."
Ha! Flattery will get you everywhere, Doc~ Just make sure you get a good look around and give me plenty of data.
<> [[Enter The Twilight Zone|$destination]]

passages.name: mid 5
passages.text:
<>

The Midnight Zone (1000 m – 4000 m)

<> <>Normally, your viewports look out into the unrelenting darkness. You might catch a glimmer of light, a rustle of movement, but unless you shine your spotlight, there is little to see. Now, your viewport looks back, with a wide unblinking eye of a giant squid.
Don't move. God, I wish we could have fit screens in with you because this is amazing. It's an Architeuthis!
"Are you at least getting this all from the outside cams?"
Every second. What can you see from the viewport?
You look at the eye, it looks back at you and you know you don't imagine the intelligence there. As soon as eye contact is made, the squid lurches away, long tentacles slipping past the viewport, before vanishing.
"It was looking right at me."
wow… just. wow.
Log: Giant Squid Architeuthis dux Estimated size: 12 m
<><><> The sea is wide and dark and gaping. You have already visited this patch of ocean.
Previously Logged: Giant Squid Architeuthis dux Estimated size: 12 m
<> [[Ascend|midtotwitrans][$destination = "twilight 5"]] [[Left|mid 4]][[Right|mid 1]] <>[[Descend|midtoabysstrans][$destination = "abyss 5"]]<>[[Descend|midtoabyss][$destination = "abyss 5"]]<>

passages.name: mid 4
passages.text:
<>

The Midnight Zone (1000 m – 4000 m)

<> <>A light glimmers in the darkness, distant and tempting. You turn your spotlight towards it to reveal rows of curved, unforgiving teeth set right before the glimmering lure.
Just keep swimming, Doc. Just keep swimming.
Log: Anglerfish Melanocetus johnsonii Estimated size: 16 cm
<><> The sea is wide and dark and gaping. You have already visited this patch of ocean.
Previously Logged: Anglerfish Melanocetus johnsonii Estimated size: 16 cm
<><> [[Ascend|midtotwitrans][$destination = "twilight 4"]] [[Left|mid 3]][[Right|mid 5]] <>[[Descend|midtoabysstrans][$destination = "abyss 4"]]<>[[Descend|midtoabyss][$destination = "abyss 4"]]<>

passages.name: abyss 3
passages.text:
<>

The Abyss (4000 m – 6000 m)

<> <>Bits of dead animals. Fecal Matter. Sand. Soot. Scales. All of it floats down the water column, the tides doing nothing to stop the inevitable pull of gravity.
You know, they call it marine snow, but it's not the kind of stuff you'd want to catch on your tongue, right?
You laugh.
"Maybe once someone gets down deep enough without a sub."
You disgust me, Doc.
You only laugh harder.<><> You have already visited this patch of darkness. <> [[Ascend|abysstomidtrans][$destination = "mid 3"]] [[Left|abyss 2]][[Right|abyss 4]] <>[[Descend|abysstofloortrans][$destination = "floor 3"]]<>[[Descend|abysstofloor][$destination = "floor 3"]]<>

passages.name: abyss 2
passages.text:
<>

The Abyss (4000 m – 6000 m)

<> <>You swivel the spotlight around in the darkness and come upon the tail-end of what looks like a massacre. The water is stained red and bits of white flesh float like small corpses in the tide. Suddenly, a crimson tentacle, wider than any you'd ever seen, reaches out from the dark and takes one of the larger scraps of meat. <>
This must be what scared away that whale before. We'd theorized that sperm whales fought squid, but man…
<>
Log: Colossal Squid Mesonychoteuthis hamiltoni Estimated size: 13 m or more
<><><> You have already visited this patch of darkness.
Previously Logged: Colossal Squid Mesonychoteuthis hamiltoni Estimated size: 13 m or more
<> [[Ascend|abysstomidtrans][$destination = "mid 2"]] [[Left|abyss 1]][[Right|abyss 3]] <>[[Descend|abysstofloortrans][$destination = "floor 2"]]<>[[Descend|abysstofloor][$destination = "floor 2"]]<>

passages.name: abyss 1
passages.text:
<>

The Abyss (4000 m – 6000 m)

<> <>Colors flash in the darkness. Reds, greens, blues, and more and more reds. They flash like stars in a darkened sky, and fade into nothing once you shine your spotlight on them.<><> You have already visited this patch of darkness. <> [[Ascend|abysstomidtrans][$destination = "mid 1"]] [[Left|abyss 5]][[Right|abyss 2]] <>[[Descend|abysstofloortrans][$destination = "floor 1"]]<>[[Descend|abysstofloor][$destination = "floor 1"]]<>

passages.name: abyss 5
passages.text:
<>

The Abyss (4000 m – 6000 m)

<> <>There are no animals on the surface with teeth like needles. Here, there are many and your light catches the glint of a smile in front of you as a serpent-like viperfish swims by. It isn't a very comforting smile.
Log: Pacific Viperfish Chauliodus macouni Estimated size: 0.3 m
<><><> You have already visited this patch of darkness.
Previously Logged: Pacific Viperfish Chauliodus macouni Estimated size: 0.3 m
<> [[Ascend|abysstomidtrans][$destination = "mid 5"]] [[Left|abyss 4]][[Right|abyss 1]] <>[[Descend|abysstofloortrans][$destination = "floor 5"]]<>[[Descend|abysstofloor][$destination = "floor 5"]]<>

passages.name: abyss 4
passages.text:
<>

The Abyss (4000 m – 6000 m)

<> <>It's hard to see anything in this kind of darkness, even with the spotlight. You only get that pinprick of light, the blips of the equipment, and Jackie's voice to guide you.
I'm catching something right at the edge of the camera feed, can you turn it about 5 degrees to left?
You tap the controls and turn the lights and camera only to gasp. All you can see is a glimpse of a shark's dorsal fin, never mind that sharks like that shouldn't be this deep. Or that big.
What…. You gotta chase it down, Doc. We need to get a view of this, it can't possibly be a shark!
[[I don't think I should.|no chase]][[Let's get a closer look then.|chase]]<><> <> You have already visited this patch of darkness.
Previously Logged: Shark???? Carcharodon megalodon? […no. That's impossible] Estimated size: 18 m
[[Ascend|abysstomidtrans][$destination = "mid 4"]] [[Left|abyss 3]][[Right|abyss 5]] <>[[Descend|abysstofloortrans][$destination = "floor 4"]]<>[[Descend|abysstofloor][$destination = "floor 4"]]<><>

links.text: Let's get a closer look then.

passages.name: light cave
passages.text:
You float towards the light, watching it grow in the darkness. Jackie starts humming. You keep humming.

The light twitches and you feel a rush of desire. You have to know what is making that light, so big yet so so far below.

[[You have to know.|siren 3]][[Leave the cave.|leave cave]]

passages.name: celebrate
passages.text:
"Jackie! Look at the depth readings I'm sending back."
She take a while to answer, the stopping abruptly, as if she'd been doing it in her sleep.
Huh, what.. What?! But Challenger Deep is—
"I know, but what do you think of the name Tangaroa Deep?"
It sounds perfect. The HMS Challenger discovered that piint and now we discover this. We'll be in textbooks for this. Can the sub take it?
[[Yes|deep yes]] [[No|deep no]]

passages.name: suntotwi
passages.text:
Well everything seems to be working great, and we've already had some amazing sightings. Can you believe we saw that Whitetip?
\n\n[[This area seems pretty active.|active]][[Looks like we're just lucky today.|lucky]]

links.text: Looks like we're just lucky today.

passages.name: dark credits
passages.text:
Thank you for playing Tangaroa Deep

If You enjoyed this game, please consider: Checking out some of my other games Following me on Twitter or Tumblr Or best of all Supporting the games on Patreon A huge thank you to Sierra, Ayuramy, Ete, Brendan and Melanie for helping me test and edit the game. [[Explore the Gallery of Creatures You Found|dark gallery]] Dive Again?

links.text: Explore the Gallery of Creatures You Found

passages.name: ignore
passages.text:
Jackie is so far from here. Miles away from the surface, from light, from air.
Please, Doc. I can barely get any readings at all.
At least, that's what you thought as you entered the temple. You thought it'd be dark and deep as the rest of the sea has been, but once again, the world surprises you.
It's too dangerous. it's too deep.
Because when you look up, you see stars. Twinkling, glittering lights set into the roof of the temple. They are almost enough to see by, as if you were no longer underwater, but instead engulfed in a welcoming night.
It isn't worth it. Please.
Through the haze of water and darkness, you can see an altar in the front of the room, decorated with glowing blue flowers (anemones?).
I don't care about the science anymore. Just come—
Her voice fizzles out as the connection finally dies. Beyond the altar, there's a deep black even your spotlight doesn't penetrate. [[Return to the Surface.|leave]] [[Enter the Darkness.|dark]]

passages.name: stay 2
passages.text:
Like this trench, you just don't know when to stop. It keeps sloping down and down, impossibly down. According to your instruments, the sea floor should be above you. For all you know, it is. All you can see is infinite, inky black upwards and infinite grey sand forward. Which is why it's so easy to spot the rubble. And it is rubble, not just rock, not just a boulder. Lying in the sand is a block of stone, smooth and perfectly square. A little beyond it, the eroded remnants of a giant archway.
….I'm not even going to say it.
You are. [[I think we found Atlantis.|atlantis]][[I think we found R'lyeh.|rlyeh]]

passages.name: tangaroa end 2
passages.text:
You float your way back to the top, and break the surface. You see the sun again, as the crew rush over and help you out of the sub. Your legs are cramped in a way you hadn't even noticed. Jackie is grinning from ear to ear.
We're gonna change the world with this, you know?
You grin back, taking a long swig of water.
"At the very least, we'll end up in some textbooks."
And if not us then, the name will live forever. Tangaroa Deep. Doesn't it just sound great?
It does, and you feel flush with your victory, but you still wonder. Could you have gone deeper? [[The End|credits]]

passages.name: Abyss
restless
passages.text:
"Getting a little restless."
Well you'll reach the bottom soon, and then you can head back up.
"I think that's what I'm afraid of. We've just found so much here. Maybe we could even find a new species!"
True. You know, I used to have a professor who said that species were like pornography. You just know it when you see it.
[[Laugh.|laugh]][[….puts a whole new spin on squid, doesn't it?|squid]]

links.text: ….puts a whole new spin on squid, doesn't it?

passages.name: temple 2
passages.text:
"I'm sorry, Jackie."
No No No NO.
[[Mute Jackie.|mute]][[Just ignore Jackie.|ignore]]

passages.name: deep no
passages.text:
"No."
You can always come back up. We've got tons of data. We can leave this trench for someone else, with a different sub.
[[Back to the surface|top end]] [[Keep going|trench 2 caves]]

passages.name: seal
passages.text:
"The seal ending wasn't so bad."
Really? I mean, she had to leave everything behind.
"Yeah, but she got what she wanted."
I guess… but even seals still need to come up for air.
<> [[Enter the Midnight Zone|$destination]]

passages.name: Midnight Zone
Listen
passages.text:
Once upon a time, there was a little diver girl. She was the best diver on the island. She could see clearer and hold her breath longer and she'd come back with the most paua shells out of everyone. But it was never enough. She always wanted to go longer, to go deeper, to get one more shell. Until one day, she dove too deep. All men are trespassers in the ocean, and she was no exception. She prayed for more breath, so she could keep diving, so she could stay in the sea. And the ocean heard her and said, You are mine now, little diver-girl. You shall have the strength to reach my depths and share my bounty with the shore, but you are mine now, and you shall never forget.
[[Keep Listening|Listen 2]]

passages.name: leave
passages.text:
Are you sure?

[[Yes|leave end 2]]
[[No|previous()]]

passages.name: error
passages.text:
"Jackie, can you check the depth readings I'm sending back up?"
...that can't be right.
"So you see it too."
Yeah. You're almost pushing 12,000 meters. That isn't… that just isn't possible. How's the sub?
"She's holding up fine."
…fine enough to keep going? The HMS Challenger got its own named point in the ocean. We could find Tangaroa Deep this time.
[[Yes|deep yes]] [[No|deep no]]

passages.name: twilight 4
passages.text:
<>

The Twilight Zone (200 m – 1000 m)

<> <>Among the grey blue of deep water, the flashing colors of a cuttlefish are amazingly easy to spot.
You know it's theorized that they use the colors to communicate, in addition to camouflage and stuff.
"I knew that."
Yeah, but this one is by itself. I wonder who it's talking to…
Log: Unknown Cuttlefish Sepiella ??? Estimated Size: 40 cm
<><><> The water is dark and hazy. But you know you've already visited this patch of ocean.
Previously Logged: Unknown Cuttlefish Sepiella ??? Estimated Size: 40 cm
<> [[Ascend|twitosuntrans][$destination = "sunlight 4"]] [[Left|twilight 3]][[Right|twilight 5]] <>[[Descend|twitomidtrans][$destination = "mid 4"]]<>[[Descend|twitomid][$destination = "mid 4"]]<>

passages.name: twilight 5
passages.text:
<>

The Twilight Zone (200 m – 1000 m)

<> You steer the ship, eyes peering out into the dusky water. Sometimes, you think you see shadows, but Jackie stays silent and the instruments pick nothing up. <><> The water is dark and hazy. But you know you've already visited this patch of ocean.<> [[Ascend|twitosuntrans][$destination = "sunlight 5"]] [[Left|twilight 4]][[Right|twilight 1]] <>[[Descend|twitomidtrans][$destination = "mid 5"]]<>[[Descend|twitomid][$destination = "mid 5"]]<>

passages.name: twilight 2
passages.text:
<>

The Twilight Zone (200 m – 1000 m)

<> <>Sunlight barely reaches here, making everything outside your spotlight merely haze and shadow. Out the port window, a massive shape looms in the darkness, with very large, very familiar fins.
That can't be another Whitetip, right? It's way too big and we're way too deep for those!
"I know, but the fin shape is just like a Whitetip. Proportions and everything."
[[Let it swim by.|shark swim by]] [[Shine the Spotlight.|shine the spotlight]]<><> The water is dark and hazy. But you know you've already visited this patch of ocean.
Previously Logged: Oceanic White-Tip Shark? Carcharhinus longimanus? Estimated size: minimum 5m
[[Ascend|twitosuntrans][$destination = "sunlight 2"]] [[Left|twilight 1]][[Right|twilight 3]] <>[[Descend|twitomidtrans][$destination = "mid 2"]]<>[[Descend|twitomid][$destination = "mid 2"]]<><>

passages.name: twilight 3
passages.text:
<>

The Twilight Zone (200 m – 1000 m)

<> <>
Huh… Do you hear that?
You stop the sub, heading the metal and waves settle around you before falling still. Far away, yet seemingly coming from all directions, you hear a haunting wail, deep and mournful.
There must be some whales nearby.
"Shh."
Jackie falls silent. The both of you sit and listen until the song fades and all you hear is the hiss of air inside your cockpit.
Log: Whales, perhaps? ???? Estimated size: ???
<><> The water is dark and hazy. But you know you've already visited this patch of ocean.
Previously Logged: Whales, perhaps? ???? Estimated size: ???
<> [[Ascend|twitosuntrans][$destination = "sunlight 3"]] [[Left|twilight 2]][[Right|twilight 4]] <>[[Descend|twitomidtrans][$destination = "mid 4"]]<>[[Descend|twitomid][$destination = "mid 4"]]<>

passages.name: twilight 1
passages.text:
<>

The Twilight Zone (200 m – 1000 m)

<> <>A giant flattened disk, balanced by two rudder-like fins slowly floats by the subs windows.
"I don't think I'll ever get over how weird sunfish look."
I know, but just imagine what you must look like to them.
Log: Ocean Sunfish Mola Mola Estimated size: 2.5 m fin to fin
<><> <> The water is dark and hazy. But you know you've already visited this patch of ocean.
Previously Logged: Ocean Sunfish Mola Mola Estimated size: 2.5 m fin to fin
<> [[Ascend|twitosuntrans][$destination = "sunlight 1"]] [[Left|twilight 5]][[Right|twilight 2]] <>[[Descend|twitomidtrans][$destination = "mid 1"]]<>[[Descend|twitomid][$destination = "mid 1"]]<>

passages.name: siren 5
passages.text:
Like all stars, your sun suddenly, wretchedly, goes out. And everything else floods back in.
—swear I'll prepare your specimens for a year. Just say anything. Do you read me? Doc? Doc!
"I'm here, Jackie. I'm here."
Your voice sounds watery. You're crying. You peer out into the inky darkness, and see nothing. No light, no sun, no grasping hands trying to pull you down. As you leave, your spotlight catches a glimpse of fin and hair. You do not look.
Damage to Hull
<> [[Leave the Cave|trench 2 caves]]

passages.name: leave cave
passages.text:
Something in the deep glimmers. That's how a lot of them hunt, after all.

You turn the ship around, humming softly. It's better to get out now and not damage the ship in this cave.

[[Leave the Cave.|trench 2 caves]]

passages.name: temple
passages.text:
<>
Please don't do this.
"I have to. Don't you want to know what this is?"
Of course I do. But the ship wasn't built for this, it could give at any second! We can come back.
"And what if we can't find it? Huh? We barely found the trench today at all. What if we can't find it again."
We will. We have to. Just, come back up. Please.
[[Return to the Surface.|leave]] [[Enter the Temple.|temple 2]]

passages.text:

passages.text:

Hull Damage: <><><><><>
%/\n

\n<>

passages.name: sunlight 4
passages.text:
<>

The Sunlight Zone (0 – 200 m)

<><>
Holy shit. Stop! Stop!
With only a few viewports inside the ship, the cameras outside pick things up much faster than you can. Grinding the ship through a halt, you tilt the ship hoping to see what she sees and are not disappointed. Whales. At least a dozen of them, pure white and hanging vertically as if caught by some invisible lure. Rocked by the tides, the sperm whales sleep. Even though they can’t hear you, Jackie whispers a soft wow. You don’t blame her.
Log: Sperm Whale Physeter macrocephalus Estimated size: 14 m
<><> <>The sea is wide, and bright, and teeming with life. But you've already visited this patch of ocean this dive.
Previously Logged: Sperm Whale Physeter macrocephalus Estimated size: 14 m
<> <> [[Return to The Surface|surface end]]<= 1>> [[Return to The Surface|coward end]]<> [[Left|sunlight 3]][[Right|sunlight 5]] <>[[Descend|suntotwitrans][$destination = "twilight 4"]]<>[[Descend|suntotwi][$destination = "twilight 4"]]<>

passages.name: sunlight 5
passages.text:
<>

The Sunlight Zone (0 – 200 m)

<><>When you think of migrations, you don’t often think of snakes, but here one is. A ribbon of yellow and black cuts through the water, heading south with astonishing speed. Normally, there are no snakes on New Zealand. You wonder if this one will make it there.
Log: Yellow-Bellied Sea Snake Pelamis platura Estimated size: .8 m
<><> <>The sea is wide, and bright, and teeming with life. But you've already visited this patch of ocean this dive.
Previously Logged: Yellow-Bellied Sea Snake Pelamis platura Estimated size: .8 m
<> <> [[Return to The Surface|surface end]]<= 1>> [[Return to The Surface|coward end]]<> [[Left|sunlight 4]][[Right|sunlight 1]] <>[[Descend|suntotwitrans][$destination = "twilight 5"]]<>[[Descend|suntotwi][$destination = "twilight 5"]]<>

passages.name: siren 3
passages.text:
You miss the sun. You didn't realize it until you saw this <<timedinsert 3s>>perfect, glorious<<endtimedinsert>> light, but you miss it with a physical ache. You need to feel the light across your skin, the searing heat sinking in. You would give anything for the sting of sunburn, the fever hot burn of light.

You'll settle for this, your own incandescent sun far below the ocean. You stare at it, unblinking. Your eyes water and go blurry. The light embraces you, consuming your viewport.

[[You miss the sun.|siren 4]]

passages.name: siren 4
passages.text: Scratching along the hull. You miss the sun. An arm, a hand, a claw. You miss the sun. A bump, a voice. THIS IS YOUR SUN. A screaming. [[YOUR SUN YOUR SUN YOUR SUN|siren 5]]

links.text: YOUR SUN YOUR SUN YOUR SUN

passages.name: sunlight 1
passages.text:
<>

The Sunlight Zone (0 – 200 m)

<><>The ship maneuvers smoothly in the water, gliding to the left. In the hazy blue of the distance, you see the distinctive curved fin and light color of an Oceanic White-Tip Shark.
Log: Oceanic White-Tip Shark Carcharhinus longimanus Estimated size: 1.8 m
Wow! What a great omen. We’re sure to see tons of animals on this dive now.
You watch the shark swim away, and can’t help but join Jackie in her optimism.<> <>The sea is wide, and bright, and teeming with life. But you've already visited this patch of ocean this dive.
Previously Logged: Oceanic White-Tip Shark Carcharhinus longimanus Estimated size: 1.8 m
<> <> [[Return to The Surface|surface end]]<= 1>> [[Return to The Surface|coward end]]<> [[Left|sunlight 5]][[Right|sunlight 2]] <>[[Descend|suntotwitrans][$destination = "twilight 1"]]<>[[Descend|suntotwi][$destination = "twilight 1"]]<>

passages.name: sunlight 2
passages.text:
<>

The Sunlight Zone (0 – 200 m)

<><>Bubbles in all sizes rise around the ship once you come to a stop. They range from tiny bubbles that cling to the ship in delicate patterns, to a few ones larger than the windows of the ship. They wobble and rise without popping. Something must be below you.<> <>The sea is wide, and bright, and teeming with life. But you've already visited this patch of ocean this dive.<> <> [[Return to The Surface|surface end]]<= 1>> [[Return to The Surface|coward end]]<> [[Left|sunlight 1]][[Right|sunlight 3]] <>[[Descend|suntotwitrans][$destination = "twilight 2"]]<>[[Descend|suntotwi][$destination = "twilight 2"]]<>

passages.name: sunlight 3
passages.text:
<>

The Sunlight Zone (0 – 200 m)

<><>The thin white tentacles of a Lion’s Man Jellyfish hang like a veil around its rusty orange body. It floats, silent, like a ghost in the water, past your ship and into the hazy blue beyond.
Log: Lion’s Mane Jellyfish Cyanea capillata Estimated size: 2 m
<><> <>The sea is wide, and bright, and teeming with life. But you've already visited this patch of ocean this dive.
Previously Logged: Lion’s Mane Jellyfish Cyanea capillata Estimated size: 2 m
<> <> [[Return to The Surface|surface end]]<= 1>> [[Return to The Surface|coward end]]<> [[Left|sunlight 2]][[Right|sunlight 4]] <>[[Descend|suntotwitrans][$destination = "twilight 3"]]<>[[Descend|suntotwi][$destination = "twilight 3"]]<>

passages.name: credits
passages.text:
Thank you for playing Tangaroa Deep

If You enjoyed this game, please consider: Checking out some of my other games Following me on Twitter or Tumblr Or best of all Supporting the games on Patreon A huge thank you to Sierra, Ayuramy, Ete, Brendan and Melanie for helping me test and edit the game. [[Explore the Gallery of Creatures You Found|gallery]] Dive Again?

links.text: Explore the Gallery of Creatures You Found

passages.name: abysstofloortrans
passages.text: <<goto $destination>>

passages.name: twitosuntrans
passages.text: <<goto $destination>>

passages.name: Sun to Twi
active
passages.text:
"Yeah. This area seems pretty active."
Maybe there's something down below that makes this spot more appealing. Some vents or a particularly strong tidal current, maybe?
"Hold off the theories until we get some data, okay? The last thing we want is to jump to conclusions."
It's called a hypothesis, Doc. I'm sure you've heard of it in between field expeditions. Besides, gathering data's your job today. So chop chop, get to it.
"Don't worry. I plan to."
<> [[Enter The Twilight Zone|$destination]]

passages.name: surface end
passages.text:
Are you sure?

[[Yes|surface end 2]]
[[No|previous()]]

passages.name: come
passages.text:
It should be impossible at the depth to open the sub. The pressure would push too hard against the hull, locking the doors tighter than any lock ever could. It calls you again, and your hand is on the latch.
COME OUT, LITTLE DIVER.
The door pushes open; Water and darkness trickle in, slowly. So slowly. Not the mad rush of pressurized water, but a lingering steady drip. You are in an impossible pit, an impossible place.
YOU ARE MINE, LITTLE DIVER.
A human is always human, you think, as you're being pulled up into the dark. Until, of course, you're not. [[The End|dark credits]]

passages.name: jackie
passages.text:
It’s tight inside the Tangaroa. It has to be. The metal dome protects you from the intense pressure you're about to face. Its armor is only barely chipped by the inclusion of three small viewports. Inside, you have room to wiggle your legs, reach the hatch, and pilot the ship. Anything else, and you'd need to come back to the surface.
Jackie: Everything is ready up here. How’re you feeling down in the tube? Ready to go?
The voice echoes oddly in the small space, but comes through clear. [[It’s a little cramped, but we’re good.|jackie 2]]

links.text: It’s a little cramped, but we’re good.

passages.name: Replace
coward end
passages.text:
Are you sure?

[[Yes|coward end 2]]
[[No|previous()]]

passages.name: top end
passages.text:
Are you sure?

[[Yes|top end 2]]
[[No|previous()]]

passages.name: StoryAuthor
passages.text: Astrid Dalmady

passages.name: trench 2
passages.text:
In the Trench (6000 m – 11,000 max depth (Challenger Deep))

<>
"Keep on eye on my depth reading, okay? I wanna see how far this goes."
Okay, but be careful. We missed this drop, so the floor could come up on you without much warning.
"I'll be careful. Don't worry."
[[Descend|trench 3]]

passages.name: trench 3
passages.text:
There are moments, as you sink deeper and deeper, where it feels like the ocean is going to gobble you up. It's just so dark, and wide and, for the most parts, quiet.
hey… do you hear that?
You don't, at first, but as soon as you're asked to listen, you hear it. It's like rocks grinding down silver bells, a song of violence and beauty.
I wonder what's making that sound.
[[Me too|trench 3 louder]]

passages.name: silence
passages.text:
You don't say a word. Thankfully, Jackie falls silent as well. It's stupid, but you don't want it to hear you. Another long low scrape and you brace yourself on the sides of the sub. You wait, and wait.
…nothing's coming up anymore. I think it's gone.
As a scientist, you normally feel excitement when facing what is undoubtedly a new species. Maybe that feeling will come later.
Log: Shark???? Carcharodon megalodon? […no. That's impossible] Estimated size: 18 m
Damage to Hull
<> [[Ascend|abysstomidtrans][$destination = "mid 4"]] [[Left|abyss 3]][[Right|abyss 5]] <>[[Descend|abysstofloortrans][$destination = "floor 4"]]<>[[Descend|abysstofloor][$destination = "floor 4"]]<>

passages.name: midtoabysstrans
passages.text: <<goto $destination>>

passages.name: twitomid
passages.text:
"This place is amazing. I can't believe all we've seen."
I know, right? We're totally going to get funded for more dives after this.
"We can only hope. Still, I want to make the best of this one. I always feel like I'm wasting time when I can't see anything."
Need a distraction?
[[What did you have in mind?|mind]][[What I need are more specimens.|specimens]]

links.text: What did you have in mind?
What I need are more specimens.

passages.name: Start
passages.text:
Tan­garoa Deep

by Astrid Dalmady
This is the first journey of the SS Tangaroa, a deep-sea submersible designed to explore one of the most mysterious and inhospitable places in the world: the depths of the Pacific Ocean. Full of measuring and safety equipment, it has room for only one passenger: you. Your only link to the surface is the radio connection to your research partner, Jackie Kapule, and her access to your external cameras. You’ve always thought it was a shame that we know more about space than we do about the ocean. [[Isn’t it time to start changing that?|jackie]]

links.text: Isn’t it time to start changing that?

passages.name: dark attribute
passages.text:

passages.name: laugh
passages.text:
You laugh, the sound bubbling up from your chest. Jackie could always make you laugh.
Well it's true!
You keep laughing.
Oh just get back to work.
<> [[Enter the Abyss|$destination]]

passages.name: jackie 2
passages.text:
"It's a little cramped, but we're good."
Heh. Good thing you’re not claustrophobic. Do they train that out of you in the doctorate program or something? I got queasy just watching you get in there.
“Of course, they do. ‘Counteracting Effects of Small Spaces on HomoSapiens’. It counts as a lab credit. I’m surprised they didn't offer it in your program.”
Haha. Very funny, Doc. I’ll just have to settle for seeing it through the video feed like everyone else. *deep breath* Okay, here we go. Releasing in 3…2…1.
[[Dive|sunlight start]]

passages.name: trench 2 bottom
passages.text:
Tangaroa Deep (15,000 m)

<> No one has ever been this deep. There are few places in the world that are unexplored, but you have found one of them. Your ship groans as you pull it to a halt, a few meters away from the sandy bottom. You see the trails of creatures cut into the sand like weaving highways, and perhaps even a shuffle of activity. You made it.
Hey, I don't want to spoil this or anything, but the ship readings are getting a little dicey. I don't think anyone ever planned to be this deep.
[[Return to the Surface.|tangaroa end]] [[Stay and take a look around.|stay]]

links.text: Stay and take a look around.

passages.name: stay in
passages.text:
It calls you. You try and move the ship, but you just struggle uselessly against whatever has you in its grasp. It calls you. The radio connection to Jackie is dead. It calls you. Your instruments are malfunctioning. You are at an impossible depth, in an impossible place.
COME OUT, LITTLE DIVER.
You take a deep, shuddering breath, one of your last, you imagine. Because a human is always human, and you can't come up for air. <> [[The End|dark credits]]

passages.name: tangaroa end
passages.text:
Are you sure?

[[Yes|tangaroa end 2]]
[[No|previous()]]

passages.name: leave end 2
passages.text:
Oh thank god. Oh thank god.
You hear Jackie mutter all the way back up, as the world gets brighter and brighter. You see the sun again, as the crew rush over and help you out of the sub. Your legs are cramped in a way you hadn't even noticed. Jackie is crying.
We're gonna change the world with this, you know?
She hands you a bottle of water.
"If we can find it again."
We'll find it.
Doubt settles in your gut like a dead whale. You should have stayed. You could have stayed.
Trust me. You'll get to go back there again.
You just nod, still thinking of the dark, deep city, and how you'll get back there. And even though you spent the whole time trapped in a bubble of steel and glass, you take a drink of water and all you taste is salt. [[The End|credits]]

passages.name: Goto
Mid to Abyss
next
passages.text:
"What happens next?"
Well it depends on who tells it. Some versions have the diver live in between, not able to stay in the ocean, but not able to really leave it behind either. In other ones, she ends up giving up on her real life and turning into a seal.
"Guess you have to be careful what you wish for."
Yeah. I always thought both endings kind of sucked.
[[Then why'd you tell me?|why]][[The seal ending wasn't so bad.|seal]]

links.text: The seal ending wasn't so bad.

passages.name: specimens
passages.text:
"What I need are more specimens."
What you need is to relax. I have an eye on the video feed, and in the meantime I can tell you a story.
"Fine."
It goes like this.
[[Listen]]

passages.name: trench 2 silence
passages.text:
In the Trench (14,000 m)

<> It just keeps going, down and down. Your hull creaks, but holds. Even with your connection to Jackie, the silence feels oppressive. [[Descend|trench 2 bottom]]

passages.name: no chase
passages.text:
"I don't think I should."
Why on earth not? You saw that thing! It was monstrous.
"Exactly, and I'm in a teeny, tiny sub. What if it hit me?!"
Of course, the moment you say it, you feel a bump. You fall still, pulse pounding in your eyes.
…I got another look at it in the cameras… It's…Doc, it's really big.
The sub tilts again, you hear the long low scrape of a fun against metal.
Doc?
[[Just tell me when its gone.|gone]][[Stay silent.|silence]]

links.text: Just tell me when its gone.

passages.name: atlantis
passages.text:
"I think we found Atlantis."
That's just a legend. It's probably just some naturally occuri-
Her words die out as your spotlight catches on an honest-to-god building. Its domed roof fades into the darkness, held up by barely eroded columns. A delicate molding decorates the edges of a wide entryway, flowing like tides or tentacles. If you aim your light just so, you can see more shapes, tall and ominous rising behind the temple. The entryway is more than wide enough to fit your sub through [[Return to the Surface.|leave]] [[Approach the Temple.|temple]][[Look behind the Temple.|behind]]

passages.name: behind
passages.text:
<<set $air to 11>>Your sub feels like it moves slower through the water. You pass the entryway, dark and gaping and turn your light beyond.

You can't see much though the dark, but you know what you do see. A city, rising from the deep, spires and towers and domed roofs that reach up from the earth and into the dark. There could be thousands of buildings here.

But the only one with a visible entryway is still the temple you first found.

[[Return to the Surface.|leave]]
[[Enter the Temple.|temple]]

passages.name: suntotwitrans
passages.text: <<goto $destination>>

passages.name: twitomidtrans
passages.text: <<goto $destination>>

passages.name: hear
passages.text:
"Did you hear that?"
Your voice shakes. It sounds odd inside the tiny cockpit, as if you'd never heard it before.
No. Nothing registering up here. What did you hear?
You rack your mind to describe it and come up with nothing.
"I don't know…"
Log: ??? ??? Estimated size: Big
[[Ascend|midtotwitrans][$destination = "twilight 1"]] [[Left|mid 5]][[Right|mid 2]] <>[[Descend|midtoabysstrans][$destination = "abyss 1"]]<>[[Descend|midtoabyss][$destination = "abyss 1"]]<>

passages.name: floor 5
passages.text:
<>

The Sea Floor? (6000 m?)

<> <>A creature, halfway between a slug and a snake, creeps along the sea floor, devouring any bits of flesh and snow that have floated this far down.
Never seen ones of these this deep before. This place is pretty weird, isn't it?
Log: Pacific Hagfish Eptatretus stoutii Estimated size: 0.5 m
<><> <> The sea is black. Only your instruments let you know you've been here before.
Previously Logged: Pacific Hagfish Eptatretus stoutii Estimated size: 0.5 m
<> [[Ascend|abysstofloortrans][$destination = "abyss 5"]][[Return to The Surface|top end]] [[Left|floor 4]][[Right|floor 1]] <>[[Huh? What's this below you?|entryway]]<>

passages.name: floor 4
passages.text:
<>

The Sea Floor? (6000 m?)

<> <>There is nothing here. Only darkness and an endless plain of sand. If you didn't know any better, you'd call it a desert. Wettest one on earth.<><> The sea is black. Only your instruments let you know you've been here before. <> [[Ascend|abysstofloortrans][$destination = "abyss 4"]][[Return to The Surface|top end]] [[Left|floor 3]][[Right|floor 5]] <>[[Huh? What's this below you?|entryway]]<>

passages.name: rush
passages.text:
"I'm in no rush."
Really? No rush to leave the tiny, cramped, underwater death trap?
"The alternative is to be back at the lab waiting for computers to analyze data, so yeah, no rush."
Ha! You can't run from reality, Doc.
<> [[Approach the Sea Floor|$destination]]

passages.name: MidtoTwi
floor 1
passages.text:
<>

The Sea Floor? (6000 m?)

<> <>Most of the sand in this patch of ocean is a dusty grey, as if the lack of light has peeled away its color as well. There is, however, one exception. It's a disk, around 5m in circumference of deep aquamarine…well, slime really is the best way to put it. It glistens oddly in the water.
Urgh. Do you think it's pollution?
"Maybe."
But you don't feel sure.<><> The sea is black. Only your instruments let you know you've been here before.<> [[Ascend|abysstofloortrans][$destination = "abyss 1"]][[Return to The Surface|top end]] [[Left|floor 5]][[Right|floor 2]] <>[[Huh? What's this below you?|entryway]]<>

passages.name: floor 3
passages.text:
<>

The Sea Floor? (6000 m?)

<> <>Everything dies. From the tiniest plankton to the largest whales, everything dies and falls to the bottom of the sea. The whales you see here (blue whales? must be, they're huge) must have died recently. Thousands of hagfish still writhe and tear at decaying flesh. Spider crabs the size of large dogs peel blubber and meat away from shining white bones. You say nothing. It's normal to be silent in a graveyard.
Log: Pacific Hagfish Eptatretus stoutii Estimated size: 0.5 m
<><> <> The sea is black. Only your instruments let you know you've been here before.
Previously Logged:Pacific Hagfish Eptatretus stoutii Estimated size: 0.5 m
<> [[Ascend|abysstofloortrans][$destination = "abyss 3"]][[Return to The Surface|top end]] [[Left|floor 2]][[Right|floor 4]] <>[[Huh? What's this below you?|entryway]]<>

passages.name: floor 2
passages.text:
<>

The Sea Floor? (6000 m?)

<> <>When people think of the depths, they normally think of black and inky blue. But the deep is all that and red. Bloody, garish red. The creatures here paint themselves with it, as red light is the first to die on its way from the surface. But you bring your own spotlight, and you make them shine with their colors. Right now, a vampire squid swims by, dusky red, it's graceful mantle hiding deadly spines within.
Log: Vampire Squid Vampyroteuthis infernalis Estimated size: 30 cm
<> <><> The sea is black. Only your instruments let you know you've been here before.
Previously Logged: Vampire Squid Vampyroteuthis infernalis Estimated size: 30 cm
<> [[Ascend|abysstofloortrans][$destination = "abyss 2"]][[Return to The Surface|top end]] [[Left|floor 1]][[Right|floor 3]] <>[[Huh? What's this below you?|entryway]]<>

passages.name: TwitoSun
Google Analytics
Main Sheet Abyss Below
Listen 2
passages.text:
And suddenly, she had just enough air to reach the surface, and she broke through the waves and breathed the salty air and smiled and dove again. Now, she could go deeper and further than ever before. But no matter how far she went, a human is always a human, and they must come up for air. Still, she dove until her boat groaned with her catch and her muscles ached from swimming. She got back in her boat, and reached for her water, only to spit it back out. What was once fresh water tasted like the briny sea. And when she went home, her family cooked a feast from what she'd caught, but she barely ate a bite. Now that she belonged to the sea, everything tasted like salt. She ran back out into the shore and asked the ocean why, and it said Because you are mine now, and you will never forget.
[[What happens next?|next]]

passages.name: trench 2 caves
passages.text:
In the Trench (13,000 m)

<> The walls have narrowed as you descend and you think, the bottom has be here. Soon. It has to be here. But before you even see a bottom, you find something else of interest. A cavern, barely visible in your spotlight. It's a smooth cave, with slick walls that reflect the light of your spotlight back with a glimmer. Bubbles emerge from the inside in time with the song you've been humming in your head. Somewhere below you, through the darkness, is Tangaroa Deep: the new deepest point in the ocean. [[Return to the Surface|top end]] <>[[Enter the Cave|siren cave]]<> [[Keep going down|trench 2 silence]]

passages.name: gone
passages.text:
"Just tell me when it's gone."
Another long low scrape and you brace yourself on the sides of the sub. You wait, and wait.
…nothing's coming up anymore. I think it's gone.
As a scientist, you normally feel excitement when facing what is undoubtedly a new species. Maybe that feeling will come later.
Log: Shark???? Carcharodon megalodon? […no. That's impossible] Estimated size: 18 m
Damage to Hull
<> [[Ascend|abysstomidtrans][$destination = "mid 4"]] [[Left|abyss 3]][[Right|abyss 5]] <>[[Descend|abysstofloortrans][$destination = "floor 4"]]<>[[Descend|abysstofloor][$destination = "floor 4"]]<>

passages.name: Sunlight Zone
squid
passages.text:
"…puts a whole new spin on squid, doesn't it?"
Ewwww. You've got a sick, sick mind, Doc. I could have stayed home you know, writing grants, nice and safe in an air conditioned room.
"Yes, but then you'd miss me."
I'd miss the science. The word you're looking for is science.
"Whatever you say, Jackie. Whatever you say."
<> [[Enter the Abyss|$destination]]

passages.name: mind
passages.text:
"What did you have in mind?"
Have you ever heard the story of the little paua diver?
"Can't say that I have."
It goes like this.
[[Listen]]

passages.name: deep
passages.text:
"I wonder how deep it goes."
This isn't part of the plan, Doc.
"Come on, Jackie. For science?
…well, if it's for science. Still, you could always come back up.
[[Back to the surface|top end]] [[Descend|trench 2]]

passages.name: chase
passages.text:
"Let's get a closer look then."
That's the spirit, Doc! It was about 12 degrees right, so head that way.
There is nothing 12 degrees right. There is nothing but darkness, and white detrius sinking towards the sea floor.
…I could have sworn…
"Me too, Jackie. Me, too."
Log: Shark???? Carcharodon megalodon? […no. That's impossible] Estimated size: 18 m
[[Ascend|abysstomidtrans][$destination = "mid 4"]] [[Left|abyss 3]][[Right|abyss 5]] <>[[Descend|abysstofloortrans][$destination = "floor 4"]]<>[[Descend|abysstofloor][$destination = "floor 4"]]<>

passages.name: shine the spotlight
passages.text:
You twist the controls and try to shine the spotlight on the shadow, but it turns and hurries back into the darkness. You only catch a tip of the fin in the light: white, as expected.
….what do you think that was, Doc? New species?
…I don't know, Jackie. Keep an eye out on the surface though, Whitetips like to follow boats, so maybe this one…"
Sure. Try convincing yourself of that first, Doc.
Log: Oceanic White-Tip Shark? Carcharhinus longimanus? Estimated size: minimum 5m
[[Ascend|twitosuntrans][$destination = "sunlight 2"]] [[Left|twilight 1]][[Right|twilight 3]] <>[[Descend|twitomidtrans][$destination = "mid 3"]]<>[[Descend|twitomid][$destination = "mid 3"]]<>

passages.name: abysstomidtrans
passages.text: <<goto $destination>>

passages.name: midtoabyss
passages.text:
How you holding up in there, Doc?
\n\n[[I'm fine.|okay]][[Getting a little restless.|restless]]

passages.name: sunlight start
passages.text:
The Sunlight Zone (0 – 200 m)

The Tangaroa detaches with a snap and you feel the ship begin to stabilize as it gets below the waves. Clear blue water is visible in every direction, as far as the eye can see. What you can’t see is below you, and that, you feel, is the interesting part.
Everything’s looking good so far. Why don’t you move around up here a bit to test the propulsion? Just make sure you pilot in a circle; you don’t want to get too far from the ship.
[[Explore|sunlight 1]]

passages.name: deep yes
passages.text:
"Yes."
Then let's make history.
[[Descend|trench 2 caves]]

passages.name: okay
passages.text:
"I'm fine."
Good. I mean, of course it's good. We've been getting some great data. Do you think we'll find a new species?
"Maybe. It's hard to tell on first glance, though, and it can be rough to tell the difference."
I know. I used to have a professor who said that species were like pornography. You just know it when you see it.
[[Laugh.|laugh]][[….puts a whole new spin on squid, doesn't it?|squid]]

links.text: ….puts a whole new spin on squid, doesn't it?

passages.name: stay
passages.text:
<>You can only see a few meters in front of you, so its impossible to tell how wide this trench is. It only make sense to explore, to look around at what feels like the newest place on earth.
I'm serious, Doc. You should probably head back up. It's too deep.
In the gloom, you see the sand slope ever so slightly downwards.
"…well it goes even deeper."
[[Return to the Surface.|tangaroa end]] [[Keep exploring.|stay 2]]

passages.name: siren cave
passages.text:
The cave feels wrong. The rock around you is smooth, as if it were volcanic, but just subtly off, with rough patches and scrapes. It looks more like a train tunnel than an undersea cavern.

Overall, the problem is that it looks made.

And like other tunnels, there is a small, glimmering light at the end of it.

[[Go towards the light.|light cave]][[Leave the cave.|leave cave]]

passages.name: top end 2
passages.text:
You float your way back to the top, and break the surface. You see the sun again, as the crew rush over and help you out of the sub. Your legs are cramped in a way you hadn't even noticed. Jackie is grinning from ear to ear.
That was a great dive, Doc.
You grin back, taking a long swig of water.
"It was. Did you get all the data you wanted?"
Oh yeah. We'll be drowning in it. Pun intended.
You smile at the joke but wonder. Could you have gone deeper? [[The End|credits]]

passages.name: why
passages.text:
"Then why'd you tell me?"
Had to kill the time somehow, and I guess I wanted to remind you.
"Of what?"
A human is always human, and they must come up for air.
<> [[Enter the Midnight Zone|$destination]]

passages.name: dark
passages.text:
You stare into the dark, trying to figure out why you only see darkness. Why your light doesn't go beyond that point. It becomes clear when the darkness moves. It isn't an absence of light, it is the presence of something. Something huge, and black and writhing. It reaches out, its mantle of black blotting out the bioluminescent stars. It wraps you up in darkness and you hear a rubble, a moaning, a voice.
COME OUT, LITTLE DIVER.
[[Come out|come]][[Stay in|stay in]]

passages.name: abysstofloor
passages.text:
According to our readings, you're coming up on the sea floor soon. Just have a look around and then you can head back up.
\n\n[[Good. It's cramped in here.|cramped]][[I'm in no rush.|rush]]

passages.name: Twilight Zone
Abysstomid
cramped
passages.text:
"Good. It's cramped in here."
Well don't you worry. Pretty soon you'll be done with sitting still in the sub and back to sitting still in the lab.
"Are you trying to make me want to stay down here?"
You can't run from reality, Doc.
<> [[Approach the Sea Floor|$destination]]

passages.name: midtotwitrans
passages.text: <<goto $destination>>
